abstract.p: This proposal defines a module for providing functions dealing with location. It has been designed to be compatible with XQuery 3.0 and XSLT 3.0, as well as any other standard based on XPath 3.0.

status.p: Must be ignored, but is required by the schema...

div1.head: Introduction
div1.p: This module contains functions for dealing with location.

div2.head: Namespace conventions
div2.p: The module defined by this document defines functions and elements in the namespace http://expath.org/ns/location. In this document, the loc prefix, when used, is bound to this namespace URI.
Error codes are defined in the namespace http://expath.org/ns/error. In this document, the err prefix, when used, is bound to this namespace URI.

div2.head: Error management
div2.p: Error conditions are identified by a code (a QName). When such an error condition is reached during the execution of the function, a dynamic error is thrown, with the corresponding error code (as if the standard XPath function error had been called).

div1.head: Get location based on the IP address
div1.p: These functions provide location details based of user agent's IP address.

div2.head: The loc:get-country-code() function
div2.p: This function returns the country code.

item.p: $ip-address is the user agent's IP address.

div2.head: The loc:get-country-name() function
div2.p: This function returns the country name.

item.p: $ip-address is the user agent's IP address.

div2.head: The loc:get-city-name() function
div2.p: This function returns the city name.

item.p: $ip-address is the user agent's IP address.

div2.head: The loc:get-time-zone() function
div2.p: This function returns the time zone.

item.p: $ip-address is the user agent's IP address.

div2.head: The loc:get-distance() function
div2.p: This function returns the distance (in kilometers) between two points, based on their IP addresses.
div2.eg: time:get-distance($first-ip-address as xs:string, $second-ip-address as xs:string) as xs:string

item.p: $first-ip-address is the first user agent's IP address.
$second-ip-address is the second user agent's IP address.
